soot.jimple.toolkits.graph

Class LoopConditionUnroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.Transformer
      • soot.BodyTransformer
        • soot.jimple.toolkits.graph.LoopConditionUnroller

  • public class LoopConditionUnroller
extends BodyTransformer
    "unrolls" the condition of while/for loops.
    before the first test of a while-loop, we can't be sure, if the body will be taken or not, and several optimizations (especially LCM) can't be done. In this class we try to solve this problem by unrolling the condition of the while-block: we make a copy of the condition-block, and redirect the back-edge of the while-loop to the new block.
    After this transformation the edge between the original condition-block and the loop-body is only executed once (and hence suitable for LCM) and we can be sure, that the loop-body will get executed.
    Exceptions are ignored (the transformation is done on a BriefBlockGraph.

    • Field Detail

      • visitingSuccs

        private java.util.Set<Block> visitingSuccs
        contained blocks are currently visiting successors. We need this to find back-edges. The "visitedBlocks" is not enough, as Java Bytecodes might not be in tree-form.

      • insertGotoAfter

        private Unit insertGotoAfter(Unit node,
                   Unit target)
        inserts a JimpleGoto to target, directly after node in the unitChain of the body.
        As we use JGoto the chain must contain Jimple-stmts.
        Parameters:
        node - the Goto will be inserted just after this node.
        target - is the Unit the goto will jump to.
        Returns:
        the newly inserted Goto

      • insertCloneAfter

        private Unit insertCloneAfter(Chain<Unit> unitChain,
                    Unit node,
                    Unit toClone)
        inserts a clone of toClone after node in the unitChain.
        Everything is done in Jimple.
        Parameters:
        node - the Unit after which we insert the clone.
        toClone - the Unit that will get cloned and then inserted.

      • getSize

        private int getSize(Block block)
        "calculates" the length of the given block in Units.

        block -
        Returns:
        the size of block.

      • getTraps

        private java.util.Map<Unit,java.util.List<Trap>> getTraps()
        returns a mapping of units to trap-changes. whenever the scope of a trap changes (ie. a trap opens or closes), an entry is added in the map, and the unit is mapped to the trap. The values associated to the keys are lists, as more than one exception can change at a unit.
        Even if a trap opens and closes at a unit, this trap is only reported once (ie. is only once in the list).
        Returns:
        the map of units to changing traps.

      • copyBlock

        private Unit copyBlock(Block block)
        puts a copy (clone) of the given block in the unitChain. The block is ensured to have the same exceptions as the original block. (So we will modify the exception-chain). Furthermore the inserted block will not change the behaviour of the program.
        Without any further modifications the returned block is unreachable. To make it reachable one must goto to the returned head of the new block.
        Parameters:
        block - the Block to clone.
        Returns:
        the head of the copied block.

      • unrollConditions

        private void unrollConditions(Block block)
        recursively searches for back-edges. if the found block is a condition-block makes a clone and redirects the back-edge.
        Parameters:
        block - the current Block.
